documentation.title: File Name Standards
documentation.standard: File name must not be a mimetype sublevel only file names, such as `plain.php`.

code.title: Valid: Is not a mimetype only file name.
Invalid: Is a mimetype only file name.

documentation.standard: Filenames should be all lowercase with hyphens separating words. If `$is_theme` property is set to `true` certain theme specific exceptions are made for underscores.

code.title: Invalid: Other punctuation or mixed case.

documentation.standard: Class file names should be based on the class name with `class-` prepended.

code.title: Valid: File name matches prefix and class.
Invalid: File name missing prefix or class.

documentation.standard: Files in `wp-includes` containing template tags should end in `-template`.

code.title: Valid: File name with proper prefix/suffix.
